unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Mean Number of Robin's Eggs
question_text: Researchers have been observing robins' nests for many years to record the number of eggs robins will lay at one time. Shown below is the probability distribution. X (# of eggs) 2 3 4 5 p(X) 0.18 0.41 0.39 0.02 Based upon this distribution, what is the mean number of eggs that a robin will lay at one time?
